doc.title: Clipboard
doc.desc: The Clipboard class provides functionality to access the OS clipboard. You cannot create objects from this class.

member.name: hasFormat
member.shortdesc: Whether the specified format exists in the clipboard

argitem.name: format
argitem.desc: Specifies the format you want to check for existence. In the current version, only cbfText can be specified. By specifying this, you can check if text format data exists in the clipboard.

member.result: True if the specified format exists in the clipboard, false otherwise
member.desc: Checks whether the specified format exists in the clipboard. Since the OS clipboard can hold multiple formats simultaneously, you can use this method to check if a specific format is among them.

member.name: asText
member.desc: Represents the text format data currently in the clipboard. You can also write values to it. Reading the value retrieves the text format data currently in the clipboard. If there is no text format data in the clipboard, void is returned. Writing a value stores text format data in the clipboard.
